originalEvent.description: Original pointer event that triggered the handler.
Original keyboard or pointer event initiating the action.

label.description: Display label shown to the user.

value.description: Value returned when the option is selected.

description.description: Optional helper text displayed beneath the option label.

disabled.description: Marks the option as disabled within the dropdown list.

option.description: Full option object corresponding to the selected value, when available.

originalEvent.description: Original change event from the native `<select>` element.

value.description: Current value of the input field.

originalEvent.description: Native event that triggered the update.

mode.description: Theme mode that is now active on the provider.

previousMode.description: Theme mode that was active before the change. `null` when no previous theme existed.

label.description: Input label rendered above the control.

placeholder.description: Placeholder text forwarded to the native input element.

helperText.description: Provides additional guidance displayed beneath the control.

error.description: Error message to display. When present the input is marked as invalid.

value.description: Current value of the input. Setting the property updates the native control.

name.description: Name attribute forwarded to the native input.

disabled.description: Disables user interaction with the input control.

required.description: Marks the input as required for form validation.

helper-text.description: Provides additional guidance displayed beneath the control.

vg-change.name: vg-change
vg-change.description: Fired whenever the value changes via user input

prefix.description: Optional content rendered before the native input (e.g. icons)

suffix.description: Optional content rendered after the native input (e.g. actions)

sources.html:
<vg-input
  label="Username"
  placeholder="Enter your username"
  type="text"
>
  
</vg-input>

<script>
  const element = document.querySelector('vg-input');
  
  // Event listeners
  element.addEventListener('vg-change', (event) => {
    console.log('vg-change', event.detail);
  });
</script>
sources.vue:
<script setup>
import 'vg/vue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const handleEvent = (event) => {
  console.log(event.type, event.detail);
}
</script>

<template>
  <vg-input
    label="Username"
    placeholder="Enter your username"
    type="text"
    @vg-change="handleEvent"
  >
  </vg-input>
</template>

disabled.description: Disables pointer interaction and visually indicates an unavailable state.

loading.description: Renders a lightweight loading indicator and prevents interaction while true.

variant.description: Visual style variant for the button.

size.description: Controls the paddings and font sizing of the button.

buttonType.description: Button type attribute mirroring the native element contract.

vg-click.name: vg-click
vg-click.description: Fired when the button is activated

prefix.description: Optional leading icon or element rendered before the label

suffix.description: Optional trailing icon or element rendered after the label

label.description: Label displayed above the dropdown control.

placeholder.description: Placeholder rendered as the first option when no value is selected.

options.description: Collection of options rendered by the dropdown.

disabled.description: Disables the dropdown and prevents user interaction.

required.description: Marks the dropdown as required when used in forms.

helperText.description: Optional text rendered below the control for guidance.

error.description: Error message displayed below the control; marks the dropdown as invalid.

name.description: Name attribute forwarded to the native select element.

helper-text.description: Optional text rendered below the control for guidance.

vg-change.name: vg-change
vg-change.description: Emitted when the selected option changes

prefix.description: Optional slot rendered before the native select

suffix.description: Optional slot rendered after the native select (for badges, icons, etc.)

sources.html:
<vg-dropdown
  label="Select an Option"
  placeholder="Choose one..."
  options="[{'label':'Option 1','value':'option1','description':'First option'},{'label':'Option 2','value':'option2','description':'Second option'},{'label':'Option 3','value':'option3','description':'Third option'},{'label':'Disabled Option','value':'disabled','description':'This option is disabled','disabled':true}]"
  value=""
>
  
</vg-dropdown>

<script>
  const element = document.querySelector('vg-dropdown');
  
  // Event listeners
  element.addEventListener('vg-change', (event) => {
    console.log('vg-change', event.detail);
  });
</script>
sources.vue:
<script setup>
import 'vg/vue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const options = ref([{"label":"Option 1","value":"option1","description":"First option"},{"label":"Option 2","value":"option2","description":"Second option"},{"label":"Option 3","value":"option3","description":"Third option"},{"label":"Disabled Option","value":"disabled","description":"This option is disabled","disabled":true}])
const handleEvent = (event) => {
  console.log(event.type, event.detail);
}
</script>

<template>
  <vg-dropdown
    label="Select an Option"
    placeholder="Choose one..."
    :options="options"
    value=""
    @vg-change="handleEvent"
  >
  </vg-dropdown>
</template>

sources.html:
<vg-dropdown
  label="Disabled Dropdown"
  placeholder="Cannot select"
  options="[{'label':'Option 1','value':'option1','description':'First option'},{'label':'Option 2','value':'option2','description':'Second option'},{'label':'Option 3','value':'option3','description':'Third option'},{'label':'Disabled Option','value':'disabled','description':'This option is disabled','disabled':true}]"
  value="option2"
  helper-text="This field is currently disabled"
  disabled
>
  
</vg-dropdown>

<script>
  const element = document.querySelector('vg-dropdown');
  
  // Event listeners
  element.addEventListener('vg-change', (event) => {
    console.log('vg-change', event.detail);
  });
</script>
sources.vue:
<script setup>
import 'vg/vue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const options = ref([{"label":"Option 1","value":"option1","description":"First option"},{"label":"Option 2","value":"option2","description":"Second option"},{"label":"Option 3","value":"option3","description":"Third option"},{"label":"Disabled Option","value":"disabled","description":"This option is disabled","disabled":true}])
const handleEvent = (event) => {
  console.log(event.type, event.detail);
}
</script>

<template>
  <vg-dropdown
    label="Disabled Dropdown"
    placeholder="Cannot select"
    :options="options"
    value="option2"
    helperText="This field is currently disabled"
    disabled
    @vg-change="handleEvent"
  >
  </vg-dropdown>
</template>

<vg-dropdown
  label="Country"
  placeholder="Select your country"
  options="[{'label':'Afghanistan','value':'af'},{'label':'Albania','value':'al'},{'label':'Algeria','value':'dz'},{'label':'Argentina','value':'ar'},{'label':'Australia','value':'au'},{'label':'Austria','value':'at'},{'label':'Bangladesh','value':'bd'},{'label':'Belgium','value':'be'},{'label':'Brazil','value':'br'},{'label':'Canada','value':'ca'},{'label':'China','value':'cn'},{'label':'Denmark','value':'dk'},{'label':'Egypt','value':'eg'},{'label':'France','value':'fr'},{'label':'Germany','value':'de'},{'label':'India','value':'in'},{'label':'Italy','value':'it'},{'label':'Japan','value':'jp'},{'label':'Mexico','value':'mx'},{'label':'Netherlands','value':'nl'},{'label':'Norway','value':'no'},{'label':'Russia','value':'ru'},{'label':'South Africa','value':'za'},{'label':'Spain','value':'es'},{'label':'Sweden','value':'se'},{'label':'Switzerland','value':'ch'},{'label':'United Kingdom','value':'uk'},{'label':'United States','value':'us'}]"
  helper-text="Scroll to see more options"
>
  
</vg-dropdown>

<script>
  const element = document.querySelector('vg-dropdown');
  
  // Event listeners
  element.addEventListener('vg-change', (event) => {
    console.log('vg-change', event.detail);
  });
</script>
sources.vue:
<script setup>
import 'vg/vue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const options = ref([{"label":"Afghanistan","value":"af"},{"label":"Albania","value":"al"},{"label":"Algeria","value":"dz"},{"label":"Argentina","value":"ar"},{"label":"Australia","value":"au"},{"label":"Austria","value":"at"},{"label":"Bangladesh","value":"bd"},{"label":"Belgium","value":"be"},{"label":"Brazil","value":"br"},{"label":"Canada","value":"ca"},{"label":"China","value":"cn"},{"label":"Denmark","value":"dk"},{"label":"Egypt","value":"eg"},{"label":"France","value":"fr"},{"label":"Germany","value":"de"},{"label":"India","value":"in"},{"label":"Italy","value":"it"},{"label":"Japan","value":"jp"},{"label":"Mexico","value":"mx"},{"label":"Netherlands","value":"nl"},{"label":"Norway","value":"no"},{"label":"Russia","value":"ru"},{"label":"South Africa","value":"za"},{"label":"Spain","value":"es"},{"label":"Sweden","value":"se"},{"label":"Switzerland","value":"ch"},{"label":"United Kingdom","value":"uk"},{"label":"United States","value":"us"}])
const handleEvent = (event) => {
  console.log(event.type, event.detail);
}
</script>

<template>
  <vg-dropdown
    label="Country"
    placeholder="Select your country"
    :options="options"
    helperText="Scroll to see more options"
    @vg-change="handleEvent"
  >
  </vg-dropdown>
</template>

sources.vue:
<script setup>
import 'vg/vue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const options = ref([{"label":"Option 1","value":"option1","description":"First option"},{"label":"Option 2","value":"option2","description":"Second option"},{"label":"Option 3","value":"option3","description":"Third option"},{"label":"Disabled Option","value":"disabled","description":"This option is disabled","disabled":true}])
const handleEvent = (event) => {
  console.log(event.type, event.detail);
}
</script>

<template>
  <vg-dropdown
    label="Required Field"
    placeholder="You must select an option"
    :options="options"
    error="This field is required"
    required
    @vg-change="handleEvent"
  >
  </vg-dropdown>
</template>

sources.html:
<vg-dropdown
  label="Priority Level"
  placeholder="Select priority"
  options="[{'label':'Low','value':'low','description':'Non-urgent items'},{'label':'Medium','value':'medium','description':'Standard priority'},{'label':'High','value':'high','description':'Important items'},{'label':'Critical','value':'critical','description':'Urgent attention required'}]"
  helper-text="Choose the appropriate priority level for your request"
  required
>
  
</vg-dropdown>

<script>
  const element = document.querySelector('vg-dropdown');
  
  // Event listeners
  element.addEventListener('vg-change', (event) => {
    console.log('vg-change', event.detail);
  });
</script>
sources.vue:
<script setup>
import 'vg/vue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const options = ref([{"label":"Low","value":"low","description":"Non-urgent items"},{"label":"Medium","value":"medium","description":"Standard priority"},{"label":"High","value":"high","description":"Important items"},{"label":"Critical","value":"critical","description":"Urgent attention required"}])
const handleEvent = (event) => {
  console.log(event.type, event.detail);
}
</script>

<template>
  <vg-dropdown
    label="Priority Level"
    placeholder="Select priority"
    :options="options"
    helperText="Choose the appropriate priority level for your request"
    required
    @vg-change="handleEvent"
  >
  </vg-dropdown>
</template>

>

sources.vue:
<script setup>
import 'vg/vue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const options = ref([{"label":"New York","value":"ny","description":"Eastern Time Zone"},{"label":"Los Angeles","value":"la","description":"Pacific Time Zone"},{"label":"Chicago","value":"chi","description":"Central Time Zone"},{"label":"Denver","value":"den","description":"Mountain Time Zone"}])
const handleEvent = (event) => {
  console.log(event.type, event.detail);
}
</script>

<template>
  <vg-dropdown
    label="Location"
    placeholder="Select location"
    :options="options"
    @vg-change="handleEvent"
  >
    <svg slot="prefix" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" style="margin-left: 12px;">
          <path d="M12 2C8.13 2 5 5.13 5 9c0 5.25 7 13 7 13s7-7.75 7-13c0-3.87-3.13-7-7-7zm0 9.5c-1.38 0-2.5-1.12-2.5-2.5s1.12-2.5 2.5-2.5 2.5 1.12 2.5 2.5-1.12 2.5-2.5 2.5z"></path>
        </svg>
  </vg-dropdown>
</template>

sources.html: Popular

<vg-dropdown
  label="Country"
  placeholder="Select your country"
  options="[{'label':'United States','value':'us','description':'North America'},{'label':'United Kingdom','value':'uk','description':'Europe'},{'label':'Canada','value':'ca','description':'North America'},{'label':'Australia','value':'au','description':'Oceania'},{'label':'Germany','value':'de','description':'Europe'},{'label':'Japan','value':'jp','description':'Asia'},{'label':'Brazil','value':'br','description':'South America'}]"
  value="us"
  helper-text="This affects your shipping options"
  required
>
  
</vg-dropdown>

<script>
  const element = document.querySelector('vg-dropdown');
  
  // Event listeners
  element.addEventListener('vg-change', (event) => {
    console.log('vg-change', event.detail);
  });
</script>
sources.vue:
<script setup>
import 'vg/vue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const options = ref([{"label":"United States","value":"us","description":"North America"},{"label":"United Kingdom","value":"uk","description":"Europe"},{"label":"Canada","value":"ca","description":"North America"},{"label":"Australia","value":"au","description":"Oceania"},{"label":"Germany","value":"de","description":"Europe"},{"label":"Japan","value":"jp","description":"Asia"},{"label":"Brazil","value":"br","description":"South America"}])
const handleEvent = (event) => {
  console.log(event.type, event.detail);
}
</script>

<template>
  <vg-dropdown
    label="Country"
    placeholder="Select your country"
    :options="options"
    value="us"
    helperText="This affects your shipping options"
    required
    @vg-change="handleEvent"
  >
  </vg-dropdown>
</template>

mode.description:
Theme mode that controls which token values are exposed.
The value is normalised to one of ThemeMode. Unsupported values fall back to "dark".

vg-change.name: vg-change
vg-change.description: Emitted whenever the active theme mode changes

default.description: Components that should inherit the active theme and design tokens

sources.html:
Cartoon Theme

This content inherits the cartoon theme styling with CSS custom properties.

Sample Button

Dark Theme

This content inherits the dark theme styling with CSS custom properties.

Sample Button

Dark Theme

This content inherits the dark theme styling with CSS custom properties.

Sample Button

Glass Theme

This content inherits the glass theme styling with CSS custom properties.

Sample Button

Light Theme

This content inherits the light theme styling with CSS custom properties.

Sample Button

Component Showcase

This card inherits the theme from the provider.

Primary Secondary Ghost

variant.description: Visual variant for the card container.

heading.description: Display heading rendered above the default slot when provided.

interactive.description: Enables hover/press affordances and makes the card keyboard activatable.

vg-action.name: vg-action
vg-action.description: Fired when an interactive card is triggered

header.description: Optional content rendered before the body, often containing a title or metadata

footer.description: Optional actions or supporting content rendered after the body

sources.html:
This is the main content of the card. It can contain any HTML content including text, images, and other elements.

Cards are useful for grouping related information together in a visually appealing container.

Featured Product

In Stock

Amazing Product

This is a featured product with custom header and footer styling.

$99.99

This card is interactive and can be clicked. It will emit a vg-action event when activated.

Try clicking or pressing Enter/Space when focused.
This card uses the outlined variant, which typically shows a border instead of a shadow.
This card uses the subtle variant for a more understated appearance.
This card has action buttons in the footer slot.

John Doe

2 hours ago

This card demonstrates using the header slot for custom content like user information.
